subject: Re: [junit] Parameterized test case pattern
msgSnippet: ... Does this mean that Elliote can t be wrong or make mistakes? Honestly, he sent 3 emails to the list and looked into the JUnit s source code only after
messageBody:
CÃ©dric Beust ? wrote:

>> As I said, it is related to test discovery.
>>
>>
>I know, but you are answering my question by explaining how JUnit's
>implementation works.
>
>The point is that from a user's standpoint, it's very counter-intuitive, and
>Elliote's sending this email to the whole mailing-list to ask for help
>should be a red flag to everyone.
>
>
Does this mean that Elliote can't be wrong or make mistakes? Honestly,
he sent 3 emails to the list and looked into the JUnit's source code
only after first two. If he would bother to look to the source code at
first place he won't have to sent any emails here. You know, I've been
using this feature for quite long time (not to mention that is is also
outlined in JUnit cookbook, which free chapter is available for
download) and wery well aware that others have some kind of mental block
on this, which could be pretty much result of some design flow in JUnit.
But this thing just work and as you know it won't be an issue in JUnit4.

You know, given the support of junit in existing tools I just take its
glitches and issues originated by the requirements for backward
compatibility as given and hope that they will be resolved in next
version of JUnit.

regards,
Eugene
